item.title: PR: remove Netstandard2.0 project - @jonsequitur
PR: update for VSCode 1.71 release - @brettfo
PR: Input type hints for SQL connection strings - @jonsequitur
item.description: This adds support for custom input type hints (SubmissionParser.SetInputTypeHint), and makes use of this API to provide a custom type hint "connectionstring-sql" for MSSQL connection strings requested by the #!connect mssql magic command.

item.title: PR: update build urls - @brettfo
item.description: PR build URIs have changed.

item.title: PR: Update public pool names - @MattGal
item.description:
This change is required to continue building PRs in the dotnet public repo. The agents and images used in the new project / organization are identical and build regressions are not expected. Updating files under eng/common is intentional to move as much as possible over to viable build agents (normally this is not done).

For questions / concerns, please stop by the .NET Core Engineering Services First Responders Teams Channel.

item.title: PR: add support for RequestInput type hints and a file picker - @jonsequitur
item.description: This adds support for RequestInput commands to carry type hints based on the magic command parser's type expectations. One example is implemented here, which is triggering a file dialog when the expected type is FileSystemInfo:

item.title: PR: add support for transformation to specific type during value sharing - @jonsequitur
PR: Don't share by ref when using `#!share --mime-type` - @jonsequitur
PR: ensure HTML and JavaScript kernels access same underlying page, enable `#!share --as declaredName` - @jonsequitur
PR: Variable sharing as specified MIME type or CLR type - @jonsequitur
item.description: This will include adding support for sharing directly to DataFrame types when querying data: #2060.

item.title: PR: Playwright-powered HTML kernel - @jonsequitur
PR: Update Jupyter Message Protocol to handle differences between kernels - @shibbas
item.description: Update the message protocol for jupyter to be compatible with https://jupyter-client.readthedocs.io/en/stable/messaging.html specifically around InspectReply and also to allow for differences in how different jupyter kernels implement the protocol. E.g. Julia does not send back a implementation_version in kernel_info_reply and R default sends a list instead of an object on comm_close.

item.title: PR: refactor Jupyter Message Protocol layer to decouple to from being ZMQ… - @shibbas
item.description: Refactor the message part of the Jupyter message protocol into a messaging layer decoupling it from the ZMQ as this is not explicitly tied to ZMQ for Jupyter but generic to the Jupyter messaging regardless of the mode of transport.

item.title: PR: update telemetry to use environment variable in tests, better naming - @jonsequitur
PR: publish AspNetCore package - @jonsequitur
PR: use kernelhost logic for browser package - @colombod
item.description: reuse setup logic as in webview

item.title: PR: Remediating Azure Artifacts Configuration Issues in your Repository - @brettfo
PR: ensure that there are no "nulls" in the signature calculation - @shibbas
item.description:
Currently, when the Jupyter message is sent over the ZMQ socket, it's sent without any nulls:

https://github.com/dotnet/interactive/blob/474c320cb13c8bd9356713faad10a39782a3af79/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Interactive.Jupyter/ZMQ/MessageSender.cs#L37

But the message with nulls translates those fields <null> in signature generation. So the signature no longer matches what is actually sent over the socket.

https://github.com/dotnet/interactive/blob/474c320cb13c8bd9356713faad10a39782a3af79/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Interactive.Jupyter/ZMQ/SignatureValidator.cs#L44

item.title: PR: Add whos for supported commands - @shibbas
item.description: Allow the who directive to be applicable all kernels that support RequestValueInfos and RequestValue command so that proxy kernels are also supported.

item.title: PR: remove unnecessary nuget restore sources that were redundant and not needed - @brettfo
PR: update PowerShell SDK version to 7.2.6 - @jonsequitur
PR: merge the specified environment variables in with the current before spawning - @brettfo
item.description: #2208 did a replacement of the environment variables, when a merge is what was really required.

item.title: PR: Update the formatting of the _style attribute's value - @bmitc
item.description:
The _style attribute function already took in a list of strings, however it wasn't clear how the strings in the list should be formatted. I found that something like

_style [
    "width: 3em";
    $"background: {colorString}";
    "display: inline-block";
    "border: 3px solid black";
]

did not work as expected, while

_style [
    "width: 3em;";
    $"background: {colorString};";
    "display: inline-block;";
    "border: 3px solid black;";
]

worked.

I think that since _style takes in a list of strings, it should automatically handle the formatting. If it only took a string, then the formatting should be explicitly given of course.

The change I made is to have the _style function automatically normalize the formatting of the strings with regards to handling the ;. The change should be backwards compatible with existing uses of _style, and I have added documentation and a test.

item.title: PR: Fix outputs, update a deprecated method, and small formatting changes - @bmitc
item.description:
The Formatting-outputs.ipynb sample for F# was not rendering correctly in GitHub.

So I fixed it, including some updates to an outdated method call and some small spelling and formatting changes.

I checked, and it looks like it is rendering properly now. I left the outputs in, as that seems to be what the previous notebook was doing.

item.title: PR: allow custom environment variables to be set when launching a kernel - @brettfo
item.description:
This also fixes a longstanding issue where we weren't properly refreshing the kernelLaunchArguments.

An example in the user's settings.json:

"dotnet-interactive.kernelEnvironmentVariables": {
    "THE_ANSWER": "42",
    "PI": "EXACTLY_3"
}

After setting those values, executing a PowerShell cell will report:

$env:THE_ANSWER

result:

42

item.description: This PR is an attempt to isolate a bug in our tests or the test runner when using the Ubuntu 20.04 base image.

item.title: PR: fix race when tests could assert before the backing operation had a chance to complete - @brettfo
item.description:
When_there_are_multiple_subscribers_there_are_no_concurrent_reads_from_underlying_source

This test was frequently failing on Linux because one of the two subscriptions didn't contain all of the expected values, and it was because the continuation check (Wait.Until message count was zero) didn't allow the two subscriptions to get all the values.

The fix is to explicitly await the expected list size (because the list size isn't what's being asserted in the test, but that the two contents are equal.)

Deferred_work_in_progress_is_allowed_to_complete_when_the_work_that_triggered_it_is_cancelled

This test was frequently failing on Linux because the parent operation (4 in this case) could run to completion before the deferred operations had a chance to cancel and that would lead to the test assertions firing too soon.

The fix is to explicitly await the completion of the deferred operations, although with a (hopefully generous) timeout to prevent hangs if something is actually broken.

item.title: PR: add --blame-crash to test run - @jonsequitur
